title: Program Manager III, Supply Chain Cost, Google Cloud
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Finance, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Management, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in program or project management. Experience with cost accounting principles, cost structures, and financial analysis. Experience in supply chain management, product costing, NPI in the technology hardware sector.
preferred_qualifications: 5 years of experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects. Experience with data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Python, R). Experience with hardware design principles, manufacturing processes, and component technologies to understand cost drivers and evaluate design trade-offs. Knowledge of cloud infrastructure concepts, architectures, and cost models to analyze cloud-related expenses.
responsibilities: Collect, clean, and analyze data related to component costs, manufacturing yields, labor rates, shipping costs, and other factors. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement solutions that optimize cost while maintaining product quality and performance. Recommend design modifications, material substitutions, or process improvements that can lead to significant cost savings. Present cost models and analysis results in a way that is easily understandable for decision-makers. Conduct sensitivity analyses to assess the impact of various factors on total cost, identifying key areas for optimization.
